se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Interface RealParameter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dependent, Sampleable, StateParameter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DoubleMap, DoubleParameter, TimesMap

    public interface RealParameter
extends StateParameter
    Simple interface for real-valued state parameters. Enables parameters with only one sub-parameter and those with several (arrays) to be treated similarly.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cache(int[] indices)
      Caches a part of or the whole current parameter.
      void clearCache()
      Clears the cached parameter.
      double getValue(int idx)
      Returns the value of a certain sub-parameter.
      void restoreCache()
      Replaces the current parameter with the cached parameter, and clears the latter.
      void setValue(int idx, double value)
      Sets the value of a certain sub-parameter.

      • Methods inherited from interface se.cbb.jprime.mcmc.StateParameter

        getName, getNoOfSubParameters

      • Methods inherited from interface se.cbb.jprime.io.Sampleable

        getSampleHeader, getSampleType, getSampleValue

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        double getValue(int idx)
        Returns the value of a certain sub-parameter.
        Parameters:
        idx - the index of the sub-parameter.
        Returns:
        the sub-parameter's value.

      • setValue

        void setValue(int idx,
            double value)
        Sets the value of a certain sub-parameter.
        Parameters:
        idx - the index of the sub-parameter.
        value - the new value.

      • cache

        void cache(int[] indices)
        Caches a part of or the whole current parameter. May e.g. be used by a Proposer.
        Parameters:
        indices - the indices of sub-parameters to cache. Null will cache all values.

      • clearCache

        void clearCache()
        Clears the cached parameter. May e.g. be used by a Proposer.

      • restoreCache

        void restoreCache()
        Replaces the current parameter with the cached parameter, and clears the latter. If there is no cache, nothing will happen and the current values remain. May e.g. be used by a Proposer.
